author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
With uncertainty over the implementation of Goods and Services Tax (GST) continuing, the knitwear manufacturers here are keenly waiting for the Union Budget to be presented on Monday.

Industrialists here feel that already ample time was lost in ushering in the GST regime mostly due to politics rather than for economic reasons.

The implementation of GST was important for garment manufacturers here as it would do away with excise duty, state Value Added Tax (VAT) and service tax.

Huge disparities in taxation existing in States provide advantages for some over others.

Rates might go up slightly but the GST regime will encourage greater compliance as it will be easy to claim tax credits.

The GST system will bring more revenue to the government as black marketing will come down, said S. Dhananjayan, a senior member of Institute of Chartered Accountants of India.

The knitwear manufacturers feel that it would become easy to get rebate claims under the VAT Act.

Preparations of financial statements for individual firms will also become easier and the manufacturers will be enthused to augment production, said G.R. Senthilvel, secretary of Tirupur Exporters and Manufacturers Association.

“GST system will end black marketing, bring more revenue to governments”
title: Knitwear makers keenly await Union Budget
